abstract.p: Outlook for US-Guatemala World Cup qualifying soccer match noted (S)

block.p: 7-0 triumph over Barbados two weeks ago, will be the starting goalkeeper for the United States when it plays Guatemala in a World Cup qualifying game tomorrow at R.F.K. Stadium in Washington.

The United States and Guatemala have 4 points each with 1-1-1 records in their group, which includes Costa Rica and Barbados, which will play tomorrow in Costa Rica. Costa Rica leads the group with 6 points with a record of 2-1-0, while Barbados is last with 3 points with a record of 1-2-0. The Americans are looking for a measure of redemption after allowing Guatemala to tie them in the last two minutes of their meeting in Matazenango, Guatemala, on July 16 in the opening game in group play.
7-0 triumph over Barbados two weeks ago, will be the starting goalkeeper for the United States when it plays Guatemala in a World Cup qualifying game tomorrow at R.F.K. Stadium in Washington.

The United States and Guatemala have 4 points each with 1-1-1 records in their group, which includes Costa Rica and Barbados, which will play tomorrow in Costa Rica. Costa Rica leads the group with 6 points with a record of 2-1-0, while Barbados is last with 3 points with a record of 1-2-0. The Americans are looking for a measure of redemption after allowing Guatemala to tie them in the last two minutes of their meeting in Matazenango, Guatemala, on July 16 in the opening game in group play.

The top two teams in the group will join the top two from two other groups in North and Central America and the Caribbean in a round-robin tournament next year to determine the three countries that will represent the region in the final stages of the 2002 World Cup in Japan and South Korea.
Mexico, Jamaica, Honduras and Trinidad and Tobago are the favorites to join the two countries that will move on from the group that includes the United States.
